total_impedance_ori_txt.item: L and R connected in series so Zb=j*w*L+R='6286.3676 / 88.1768°' Ohm
C and Zb connected in series so Za=1/(j*w*C)+Zb='6127.2953 / 88.1295°' Ohm
The total impedance is Za = '6127.2953 / 88.1295°' Ohm

total_impedance_txt.item: L and R connected in series so Zb=j*w*L+R='6286.3676 / 88.1768°' Ohm
C and Zb connected in series so Za=1/(j*w*C)+Zb='6127.2953 / 88.1295°' Ohm
The total impedance is Za = '6127.2953 / 88.1295°' Ohm

solution.item: We know that generator frequency is f=1MEG Hz, w=2*pi*f
At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes
L and R connected in series so Zb=j*w*L+R='6286.3676 / 88.1768°' Ohm
C and Zb connected in series so Za=1/(j*w*C)+Zb='6127.2953 / 88.1295°' Ohm
The total impedance is Za = '6127.2953 / 88.1295°' Ohm
Now we calculate the current on R
We know that the voltage between Source nodes is '100.0000 / 0.0000°' V. So the current on Source is '100.0000 / 0.0000°'/Za = '0.0163 / -88.1295°' A
(1) The components C,Zb connected in series.
(1) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is '100.0000 / 0.0000°' V.
(1) Zb is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Zb is Zb/Za*'100.0000 / 0.0000°' V = '102.5961 / 0.0473°' V.
(1) The current on Zb is the 'voltage on Zb / Zb' = '0.0163 / -88.1295°' A .
(2) The components L,R connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is '102.5961 / 0.0473°' V.
(2) R is in the voltage divider so the voltage on R is R/Zb*'102.5961 / 0.0473°' V = '3.2641 / -88.1295°' V.
(2) The current on R is the 'voltage on R / R' = '0.0163 / -88.1295°' A .
